abstract: The truck maker rejected Mr. Icahn’s $3 billion unsolicited takeover bid on Friday, deeming it too low. It also adopted a poison pill to protect itself against further moves by the billionaire investor.
snippet: The truck maker rejected Mr. Icahn’s $3 billion unsolicited takeover bid on Friday, deeming it too low. It also adopted a poison pill to protect itself against further moves by the billionaire investor.
lead_paragraph: The Oshkosh Corporation rejected Carl C. Icahn’s $3 billion unsolicited takeover bid on Friday, deeming it too low. The company, a truck maker based in Oshkosh, Wis., also adopted a poison pill to protect itself against further moves by the billionaire investor.

headline.main: Oshkosh Rejects Icahn’s Offer and Moves to Protect Itself
headline.print_headline: Oshkosh Rejects Takeover Offer and Moves to Protect Itself

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
